title: Fix your Bots riot.
body: It's wonderful to know that Riot only focuses on the money making portion of their game and not anything else, hint the botting problems for low levels trying to level up. Does nothing to help the newcomers want to continue to play the video game. Find a solution to your problems.

replies.body:
The solution is implemented.
They can't stop people from creating bots.
When they find the bots they ban them.
The bots stick around for a while because they ban them in waves.
If banned on site, whoever is making/using bots would potentially know what triggers the system and they would patch them up.
Imagine what would happen then.
I'd rather have them using a long term solution than a temporary one.

"the solution is implemented" - looks good but NOOOOOO!!!! does not work there are rampant bots marauding thru aram like a locust plague at the moment, aram needs to be removed as a game mode till a real solution is made, not this belittling of a hugely damaging situation

its very clear to me that the majority of hardcore players do not care as they do not play this. and just play ranked summoners rift, so they never have to deal with bots - this is where the "solution is implemented" they have pushed the bots onto aram where they do not deal with them, the problem is some people such as myself, are not interested in competitive gaming, would just like to be able to have a enjoyable game of aram  without an external influence destroying the game experience

I hope riot does eventually come up with a long term solution, as of now they have a massive failure

if you like playing ARAM then just keep on playing and the bots are gone.
Once your ARAM MMR goes up you won't see them any more.
Bots can't win a lot of games by nature and you only need around 10 wins after you hit lvl30 to get rid of them.

Go trough the boards a little.
You will see there are a lot of posts about people moaning they were banned for using 3rd party software.
There was a ban wave a couple of days ago and it also wiped the bot accounts.
So all the bots you played against are now gone.
New ones are made every day, but they will never stay in the game forever.

You can be angry at riot, I do see your point.
But dealing with bots for 20 games and never again is much better than dealing with them every game.
That would eventually happen if they banned them on site.
They are doing what is best for the game in the long run.

the bots have gone as of now, I wonder how long this will last, seems that they must have done something in the last patch, that is a very good thing
guess we will se in time how long they are gone for, the longer the better

You probably just got your MMR high enough.
Bots can't reach it.

They do what they can but it's not a battle against botting, it's a war. Accounts can be made for free with nothing more than a unique email (which can also be made free), which allows botters to create them in massive amounts. They will always get some games in before they are caught, which sucks, but there's not much that can be done before they're discovered. Bot bans are done in waves so that the botters have a difficult time figuring out how they get caught; however, they improve their botting methods too and it's an ever shifting goalpost as Riot gets ahead of them again.

It definitely does suck, but Riot is not blind to the problem and they don't stop banning them or improving their detection. Try to bear with it in the lowers levels which harbors most of them (they typically get banned before getting far) and don't forget to report them in the post-game. If you find level 30 bots please submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to help Riot catch them.

There is no way to prevent bots.

You could say "but single them out based on how bad they are".. Well, guess what, a lot of those are actually real players that rarely say anything and are really, really terrible.

In about 3 days you can out-level the bots and never see them again, just stick with it.
Do you have a suggestion that would help solve the botting problem?
